intro: Pleiarina humaensis, commonly known as the Humaensis pleiarina, is a unique flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine, velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
